author: Huw
title: Official Brickset review
review:
Having read that the polybags first seen in Sweden had been found in Danish Netto stores, I thought I'd try and track some down whilst in Copenhagen.

Normally Google Maps can be relied upon to find the location of specific stores in strange cities but on this occasion it was useless. The nearest one to my hotel was apparently 2 miles away. But, I had time to kill so I walked to it, only to find when I got there it was not a 'proper' Netto but a small food-only store. Being close to the city centre by this time, I walked into town, and on the way stumbled across another small branch. Still no joy.

Later that evening, I met up with Chris, wiredforsound, in the city and told him of my failure. He then said that there was a large Netto right next to the place he was staying, just 10 minutes from the hotel! So, on our way back home, we took a short detour to this branch and arrived just before it closed at 10pm. We found three solitary, lonely, polybags left: three 30183 Little Car, and, according to a shelf stacker, no more out the back. 

Now, I like a polybag as much as the next Brickset administrator but, really, it's pathetic isn't it!

The windscreen in particular is terrible and to make it worse there's a white plate in the middle underneath, making it look very un-uniform.

It fills a gap in my collection, but other than for that reason, I really can't recommend you take the trouble to track this one down. It's rubbish -- no wonder it was the only one left in the store!

author: Thelone
title: The little brother of the Mini Sports Car
review:
I bought this and a few other polybags after reading here that they were available in Belgium.

This is a neat little car based on the sports car released last year. Obviously, it's pretty basic and insanely easy to build, but you can't really expect wonders from a 4â‚¬ set and this is not why they are made for anyway.

The parts are common and mostly in black, so I wouldn't recommend buying this just for parts.

In my opinion, it's worth the price. This is no masterpiece by any stretch of the imagination, but a decent little set for Creator and polybag collectors and also a good way to introduce Lego to kids.

author: Odeinoichus
title: A Little Car that May Be a Bit Dissapointing.
review:
Set #30183 Little Car: Here comes another Polybag review from LEGO Creator, this is a bit more recent compared to some of the others. This set is known as the Little Car and it’s basically a small automobile to build and have fun with. Is it worth tracking down if you missed it? Read on and we’ll see.

Pros:

  • Fast and easy build should take between six and ten minutes to complete, giving a fun model to play with once finished.

  • Model is compact and designed relatively well.

Cons:

  • Windshield design could use a bit better parts use.

Overall opinion

As I said when I reviewed the Fast Car, a similar vehicle based Polybag from 2014 it’s difficult to find anything to really call this set out on, and as far as the pros of the set go it can be a bit weaker. Honestly the best thing to discuss about the set is the fact that it’s a cheap fun little model that offers something to build and play with. This is what LEGO Creator and LEGO in general is all about. That being said I’d recommend tracking this down if you can, I have a preference for these vehicles and it’s difficult to say no to them.

I do however understand it may not be everybody’s interest, if you aren’t a fan of Creator it’s definitely safe to skip.
